byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY, JAMES KANTER and ANITA RAGHAVAN

lead_paragraph: “My immediate reaction was, ‘We are getting attacked by terrorists,’ ” one witness said, echoing others who described explosions and carnage that wrenched them into thinking of the Nov. 13 killings in France.

headline.print_headline: Blasts Instantly Make Survivors Think of Paris Terror
headline.main: Brussels Survivors Say Blasts Instantly Evoked Paris Attacks

snippet: “My immediate reaction was, ‘We are getting attacked by terrorists,’ ” one witness said, echoing others who described explosions and carnage that wrenched them into thinking of the Nov. 13 killings in France.
abstract: Survivors of Brussels bombings report they assumed immediately that terrorist incident was taking place and thought of Paris attacks, even as event was unfolding; mindset reflects long-simmering fears.
